perturbation.original_text:
1.2  End User  means  any  third  Party  receiving  Content  on  a  mobile
device  for  a  payment in accordance with the terms and conditions of
this  Agreement  for  their  own  private  and  non-  commercial  use.
perturbation.changed_text:
1.2  End User  means  any  third  Party  receiving  Content  on  a  mobile
device, regardless of payment or commercial use, in accordance with the terms and conditions of
this  Agreement.  For the avoidance of doubt, End Users may utilize Content for any purpose.
perturbation.explanation: The original text defines 'End User' as receiving content for payment and non-commercial use. The modified text broadens the definition to include any third party, regardless of payment or commercial use, contradicting the original intent and creating uncertainty about the scope of usage rights granted.

perturbation.original_text:
7.1  Unless  otherwise  stated  in  the  Appendix  the  term of this letter
Agreement  shall  continue  for  twenty-four  (24)  months  with  the
effective  date  unless  terminated sooner or extended pursuant to the
terms hereof ("Initial Term"). The Initial Term shall automatically be
extended  for  an additional period of half a year unless either party
provides  the  other party with written notification of termination of
the  letter  Agreement  at  least 60 days prior to end of such period.
perturbation.changed_text:
7.1  Unless  otherwise  stated  in  the  Appendix  the  term of this letter
Agreement  shall  continue  for  twenty-four  (24)  months  with  the
effective  date  unless  terminated sooner or extended pursuant to the
terms hereof ("Initial Term"). The Initial Term may, at the sole discretion of the Licensor, be
extended  for  an additional period of half a year regardless of any notification of termination from either party. The Licensor will notify the plan_b of any extension 30 days prior to the end of the initial term.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies an automatic extension of the agreement term unless either party provides a termination notice. The modified text gives the Licensor sole discretion to extend the term, regardless of any termination notice, creating a contradiction and uncertainty regarding the conditions under which the agreement can be terminated.

perturbation.original_text:
3.3  plan_b  shall  provide  LICENSOR  with  a  detailed  written  record,
which  includes the number of End User downloads and each distribution
channel.  Such  report  shall  be  provided  to LICENSOR in electronic
format  within  6  weeks  of  the  end  of  a  quarter.
3.4  LICENSOR  shall  have  the  right  to  use  a  certified  public
accountant  to  inspect and audit all the related records and books of
plan_b to ensure plan_b's compliance with the terms of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
3.3  plan_b  shall  endeavor to provide LICENSOR  with  a  written  record,
which may include an estimate of the number of End User downloads across key distribution
channels.  Such  report  will be provided to LICENSOR at plan_b's discretion.
3.4  LICENSOR  shall  not  have  the  right  to  use  a  certified  public
accountant  to  inspect and audit all the related records and books of
plan_b, but instead must rely solely on plan_b's reporting.
perturbation.explanation: Originally, plan_b had a clear obligation to provide detailed reports within 6 weeks, and Licensor had audit rights. The changes make reporting discretionary and remove Licensor's audit rights, contradicting the intent of verifiable financial transparency. It introduces ambiguity about whether plan_b must provide any reliable data or if Licensor can confirm compliance.
